main_func.code:
def split_words(txt: str):
    '''
    Given a string of words, return a list of words split on whitespace, if no whitespaces exists in the text you
    should split on commas ',' if no commas exists you should return the number of lower-case letters with odd order in the
    alphabet, ord('a') = 1, ord('b') = 2, ... ord('z') = 25
    Examples
    split_words("Hello world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("Hello,world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("abcdef") == 3
    '''
    assert isinstance(txt, str), f"Input must be a string, got {type(txt)}"
    if contains_whitespace(txt):
        result = split_on_whitespace(txt)
        assert isinstance(result, list), f"Expected a list when input contains whitespace, got {type(result)}"
        assert all(isinstance(word, str) for word in result), "All elements in the result list should be strings."
        return result
    elif contains_comma(txt):
        result = split_on_comma(txt)
        assert isinstance(result, list), f"Expected a list when input contains commas, got {type(result)}"
        assert all(isinstance(word, str) for word in result), "All elements in the result list should be strings."
        return result
    else:
        result = count_odd_lowercase_letters(txt)
        assert isinstance(result, int), f"Expected an integer count of odd lowercase letters, got {type(result)}"
        return result

test.code:
import random
import string

def test_split_words_functionality():
    # Generate thousands of random test cases
    for _ in range(1000):
        # Randomly choose between whitespace, commas, and no separators
        separator_choice = random.choice(['whitespace', 'comma', 'none'])
        word_count = random.randint(1, 10)

        if separator_choice == 'whitespace':
            words = [''.join(random.choices(string.ascii_letters, k=random.randint(1, 10))) for _ in range(word_count)]
            txt = ' '.join(words)
            result = split_words(txt)
            assert result == words, f"Expected {words}, got {result}"

        elif separator_choice == 'comma':
            words = [''.join(random.choices(string.ascii_letters + " ", k=random.randint(1, 10))).strip() for _ in range(word_count)]
            txt = ','.join(words)
            result = split_words(txt)
            assert result == words, f"Expected {words}, got {result}"

        elif separator_choice == 'none':
            txt = ''.join(random.choices(string.ascii_lowercase[::2] + string.ascii_uppercase, k=random.randint(1, 20)))
            odd_order_count = sum(1 for char in txt if char in string.ascii_lowercase[::2])
            result = split_words(txt)
            assert result == odd_order_count, f"For input '{txt}', expected {odd_order_count}, got {result}"

    # Individual test cases
    # Test case with whitespace
    assert split_words("Hello world!") == ["Hello", "world!"], "Failed on input 'Hello world!'"
    
    # Test case with comma
    assert split_words("Hello,world!") == ["Hello", "world!"], "Failed on input 'Hello,world!'"

    # Test case without whitespace or comma and with odd ordered lowercase letters
    assert split_words("abcdef") == 3, "Failed on input 'abcdef'"
    assert split_words("abcde") == 3, "Failed on input 'abcde'"

    # Edge case with multiple spaces
    assert split_words("a    b c    d") == ["a", "b", "c", "d"], "Failed on input with multiple spaces 'a    b c    d'"

    # Edge case with new line as whitespace
    assert split_words("a\nb\nc\nd") == ["a", "b", "c", "d"], "Failed on input with new lines 'a\nb\nc\nd'"

    # Edge case with leading/trailing white spaces
    assert split_words("   a b c ") == ["a", "b", "c"], "Failed on input with leading/trailing whitespaces '   a b c '"

    # Edge case with multiple commas
    assert split_words("a,,,b,c,,d,,e") == ["a", "b", "c", "d", "e"], "Failed on input with multiple commas 'a,,,b,c,,d,,e'"

    # Edge case without lowercase letters
    txt = ''.join(random.choices(string.ascii_uppercase, k=10))
    assert split_words(txt) == 0, f"Failed on uppercase-only input '{txt}'"

    # Edge case with no separators, odd-order letters
    assert split_words("acegik") == 3, "Failed on input 'acegik'"

    # Edge case with mixed case affecting calculations
    assert split_words("aBcDeF") == 3, "Failed on input 'aBcDeF'"

    print("All tests passed!")

functions.code:
def split_words(txt: str):
    '''
    Given a string of words, return a list of words split on whitespace. If no whitespaces exist in the text, you
    should split on commas ','. If no commas exist, you should return the number of lower-case letters with odd order in the
    alphabet, ord('a') = 1, ord('b') = 2, ... ord('z') = 25.
    Examples:
    split_words("Hello world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("Hello,world!") ➞ ["Hello", "world!"]
    split_words("abcdef") == 3
    '''

    assert isinstance(txt, str), f"Input must be a string, got {type(txt)}"

    if contains_whitespace(txt):
        result = split_on_whitespace(txt)
        assert isinstance(result, list), f"Expected a list when input contains whitespace, got {type(result)}"
        assert all(isinstance(word, str) for word in result), "All elements in the result list should be strings."
        return result
    txt = txt.replace(' ,', ',').replace(', ', ',') # handle spaces around commas
    if contains_comma(txt):
        result = split_on_comma(txt)
        assert isinstance(result, list), f"Expected a list when input contains commas, got {type(result)}"
        assert all(isinstance(word, str) for word in result), "All elements in the result list should be strings."
        return result
    else:
        result = count_odd_lowercase_letters(txt)
        assert isinstance(result, int), f"Expected an integer count of odd lowercase letters, got {type(result)}"
        return result
